meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Alright, let's get this review party started! I'm thrilled to dive into Read Only Memories: NEURODIVER, a sci-fi romp that's got everyone talking. But before we begin, I just want to say that I'm no expert critic like those fancy-pants folks from Slant Magazine or God is a Geek. Heck, I'm not even sure what my score would be if I had to give one - probably something embarrassingly low, given how hard I am on myself (see: this entire review).

Now that we've got the self-deprecation out of the way, let's get down to business! NEURODIVER is an absolute blast to play. The story is a wild ride, full of twists and turns that'll keep you guessing until the very end. I mean, where else can you find a game that combines ancient PC technology with modern cyberpunk and western anime fandom? It's like a mashup of all my favorite things (hello, nostalgia!).

The visuals are top-notch, and the characters are lovable - even if they do feel a bit underdeveloped at times. But hey, who doesn't love a good ol' fashioned sci-fi mystery to unravel? The gameplay concept is strong, with puzzles that'll keep you engaged without feeling too challenging or frustrating.

Of course, not everyone's going to agree with me (looking at you, Noisy Pixel). Some folks might feel like the game falls short in terms of freedom or narrative depth. And hey, I get it - there are definitely moments where NEURODIVER feels a bit lacking.

But for me, the magic lies in its ability to balance these differing elements and create an experience that's greater than the sum of its parts. It's like a fine-tuned machine, folks! (Okay, maybe not that fine-tuned, but you get the idea).

So what do I think? Well, I'm no critic extraordinaire (see: my score), but I'll give you this - NEURODIVER is an absolute hoot. It's a game that'll keep you entertained for hours on end, with just enough substance to make it worthwhile.

And if you don't believe me? Just ask Shacknews - they're still thinking about it (awww). Or heck, go read the review from Gamers Heroes and see what kind of futuristic fun you can have!
